urls.title: Job Opening: Strategic Lead for Place and Culture in the North | Cumbria LEP
urls.description: Are you passionate about making the North the best place to live, visit, work and invest? Would you like to be part of an exciting opportunity to influence and shape the role of culture and place in economic development across the North of England? Do you have experience of influencing policy at a senior level with civic and business leaders and strategic funding organisations? The NP11 Northern group of Local Enterprise Partnerships (LEPs) is working in partnership with Arts Council England, Environment

tweets.text: The NP11 Northern group of Local Enterprise Partnerships in collaboration with @HeritageFundUK, @ace_national, @EnvAgency and @HistoricEngland are recruiting a Strategic Lead for Place and Culture who will lead on a project to promote positive place-making https://t.co/d33riVFKbe https://t.co/9MpbuFhBQR

tweets.text: @MariaHerlihyEA @johncurtinEA @EnvAgencySE @Jennifer_Hil1 @MarkHill03 @sarahchareEA @wifo_ea They towed all that with an outlander üò≥

Heavy rain in the @RiverChess, no notification from Thames Water since 27th Jan, sure sewage is still being discharged from the Chesham STW. Asked both the @EnvAgency and local environmental health teams to get message out to the public. Little or no evidence this has happened. https://t.co/lYtXdgInOr

Next band of weather coming in üòû

The ground is #saturated so levels are responding fast. Last weeks #water is still in the lower reaches of the #Severn too so you‚Äôre going hear us talking about multiple peaks. 

Please stay #floodaware & watch https://t.co/xao8qx9ADP for latest https://t.co/1n8qHrpA1E

It‚Äôs been a very wet Saturday, our teams are out in the borough monitoring  rivers & following up reports of any flooding concerns. If you have a concern, call the @EnvAgency helpline 0345 988 1188 or the out of hours emergency line 01708 433999 visit https://t.co/exBluI9NNb https://t.co/cFHwtNTFmW
‚õîÔ∏è We're closing Waterside #Evesham due to flooding https://t.co/bhdGncO9ze

Community officers out on site Checking levels in advance of #Cookham defence operation.#Incidentprepardness .‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© ‚Å¶‚Å¶@johncurtinEA‚Å© ‚Å¶@sarahchareEA‚Å© https://t.co/MD4amj8n1c

We‚Äôve deployed additional pumps to manage levels on Burstwick Drain in Hull today. Water normally discharges from the drain at low tide but we are currently also pumping water through the high tide using 4 of our High Volume Pumps. We have teams out monitoring levels and pumps. https://t.co/3HERklt8K7

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - Thanks to CEV Peter for the 14:00hrs report. The river level is still 27.6m AOD and steady 
Church Street is also partly flooded @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @WiltshireWinter @EnvAgencySW @BBCWiltshire @HeartWilts. https://t.co/LmvpnV5BYE

Field teams responding to flooding at #wargrave in #Shiplake , unfortunately due to the volume of water and the local river it has come out of the banks .Do take care when driving in flooded areas. #TeamEA .‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@wifo_ea‚Å© ‚Å¶‚Å¶ https://t.co/yls8LPDcYR

First of the temporary defence barriers arriving at #SouthHinksey ,field teams are ready to start deployment .#TeamEA .@EnvAgencySE @Jennifer_Hil1 @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @sarahchareEA @wifo_ea https://t.co/3kaqK0VPfE
@PennyMordaunt @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySE @AlanMakMP @GillianKeegan Great to see action being taken. Sea-swimming so good for mental and physical health. We need clean waters @ElleGray111 @amyyburt

The Environment Agency says it's investigating why 
Northcliffe Dike near Shipley has turned blue. It says it's likely to be caused by a trace dye https://t.co/VIVdD5fOPg

**Flood warning***
Issued by @EnvAgency for Colne Brook in Colnbrook including Horton and Wraysbury.    
Immediate action is required. 
*Install flood defences/sandbags
*Move property, especially electricals, from ground floor
*Charge mobile phones
*Do not go out into flood water https://t.co/VYbW7IdiuQ

#FieldTeams have been out again today clearing screens and checking our #CriticalAssets in #Warwickshire. Video taken by Daz earlier today from Mill Bridge in #Leamington. Check your #FloodRisk and stay #FloodAware. @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nfaWuy0zBI

tweets.text: Officers are investigating a blue discolouration to Northcliffe Dike near Shipley. This blue colour is thought to be caused by a trace dye, which would represent a low risk of harm to the environment. If you see a potential environmental hazard, report it to us on 0800 807060 https://t.co/Or8OV6N4EV
